page.title: 10Shopping, for Harberton
page.content:
There is not a shop or post office within the whole 12Km. square. The village is served by a travelling butcher and fish monger once a week.
Most families shop for bulk food items fortnightly or monthly at out of town super stores, day to day items are purchased from Totnes, although many comment on the problem of parking in Totnes in the town. The lack of a post office means that pensioners without their own transport find difficulty in collecting pensions, prescriptions and shopping. The gardener is catered for we have a garden centre on the main road, which is on the very outskirts of the village.
